Width: user defined name, used in other csv files to reference this sprite
This is one of two things, if a single animation spans multiple textures, then it's the reference to Col A of Textures.csv
Otherwise it is the file name of the texture.  The location of the file depends on the type of sprite.

If the sprite does not start at 0,0 in the texture file, this is the coordinates where it starts
see source x
how to scale the sprite, 1.0 is the same size as the texture and will be used in the case of no entry in this cell

The total number of angles for this sprite

The total number of animation frames for this sprites

The animation speed, the program will show each frame for this long
If the sprite is not drawn at terrain height, this is the amount added to the terrain height at that location
before drawing the sprite
This is the exact frame of animation that the kill (shot or stab) should occur on.  This is required for shooting and melee.
Graphics cards don't like switching textures, so it is in your best interest to combine as many sprites onto
a single texture as possible.
